message:
A few minutes before the assassination, Muhammad Awad, the commander of Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades in Tulkarm, walks around like a peacock, against the background of the destruction caused by the IDF bulldozers, and boasts on the communication network that "the men of the Tulkarm refugee camp will not retreat and the occupier should know this."

After a short time, he was met with a UAV missile.

message:
Hamas-identified media claim that the total number of dead yesterday in the IDF attacks in Khan Yunis reached 8, in addition to 250 wounded.

In the northern sector of the Gaza Strip, the Palestinians report 16 deaths tonight in 3 attacks on buildings:

8 killed in the attack on the house of the Daya family in the Zabra neighborhood.

4 killed in the attack on the Jamatsi family home on a-Nefek Street in the center of Gaza City.

4 killed in the attack on the Jalhum family home in the Jabaliya refugee camp.

Location: northern Gaza Strip (particularly Zabra neighborhood, Gaza City, and Jabaliya refugee camp)

Description: Hamas-identified media reported 16 deaths in IDF attacks on buildings in northern Gaza. The attacks targeted the Daya, Jamatsi, and Jalhum families, killing 8, 4, and 4 members, respectively. The attacks are ongoing at the time of reporting.

message: South Lebanon: the assassination of Sadek Atawi 👆 in Chaqra, according to the IDF spokesperson.
event_breakdown: South Lebanon: the assassination of Sadek Atawi in Chaqra, according to the IDF spokesperson.

message:
Lebanese sources: Sadek Atawi who was seriously injured in the Israeli attack 👆on the van in Chaqra earlier today died of his wounds.

He was a military operative of Hezbollah.

Hezbollah has not yet officially announced his death, but announced that it attacked the "Neria base, where Golani forces are now located" using suicide drones, in response to this elimination.
event_breakdown: Sadek Atawi, a military operative of Hezbollah, died on Wednesday after he was seriously injured in an Israeli attack earlier in the day on a van in Chaqra. Hezbollah has not yet officially announced his death, but announced that it attacked the "Neria base, where Golani forces are now located" using suicide drones, in response to Atawi's elimination.

message:
Further to the discussions on social networks about the organizational affiliation of the terrorists who were killed today in Tulkarm:

According to a proclamation of Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades, Muhammad Awad (Abu Abdu) and Muhammad Badie were both operatives of the Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades (photo number 1 - circled in yellow). 
In photos number 2 and 3 you can see the headband of the Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades on the head of Muhammad Awad.

In photo number 4 you can see an example of the cooperation between Ashraf ("Azkihim") Nafe from the military wing of Hamas in Tulkarm and Muhammad Awad - the logo of al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades is attached to the green flag of Hamas.

In conclusion - there is no doubt that Mohammad Awad and Mohammad Badie belonged to Fatah's al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades and they have a collaboration that was not born yesterday with Ashraf Nafe from the military wing of Hamas.
event_breakdown: Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades, Muhammad Awad (Abu Abdu) and Muhammad Badie were both operatives of the Al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigades.

message: The Houthis: This is the UAV known as "Yafa" (Jaffa) which we launched towards Tel Aviv on July 19
event_breakdown: The Houthis: On July 19, the Houthis, a Shiite rebel group, announced that they had launched a Qasef-2K drone, which they have designated the "Yafa (Jaffa) UAV," towards Tel Aviv. However, it was later reported that the drone was intercepted by the Saudi-led coalition before it could strike its target. This marks the second time this year that the Houthis have targeted Tel Aviv with their drones.

message: The Tulkarm refugee camp after IDF bulldozers passed through it last night.
event_breakdown: IDF bulldozers passed through the Tulkarm refugee camp last night.

message:
Joint IDF and ISA announcement:

Overnight, the IDF, ISA, and Israeli Border Police conducted a joint counterterrorism operation in the Tulkarm area, as part of a series of over 50 counterterrorism operations in the area since the beginning of the war. The soldiers struck a number of armed terrorists in exchanges of fire and dismantled numerous explosives that had been planted underneath the roads.

During the operation, an IAF drone struck several terrorists from various terror organizations in the Tulkarm area. Among those struck were terrorists who were involved in the planning and carrying out of attacks against IDF soldiers and the State of Israel from the Tulkarm area. 

Among those eliminated was Ashraf Nafa, the Head of the Hamas branch in the Tulkarm area. Ashraf was responsible for manufacturing and embedding explosives intended to attack IDF soldiers, as well as recruiting new operatives into the Hamas organization.
Additionally, he was involved in numerous attacks against IDF soldiers in Judea and Samaria, and was in contact with external Hamas terrorists who advanced terror attacks in Judea and Samaria. 

Furthermore, the terrorist Muhammad Awad was eliminated during the operation. Muhammad was a terrorist in the area of Tulkarm, where he was actively involved in shooting attacks against IDF soldiers. In addition, he raised terror funds to support the battalion's activity in the area, and procured weaponry for the battalion.
event_breakdown: IDF and ISA conduct counterterrorism operation in Tulkarm area, eliminating Hamas members Ashraf Nafa and Muhammad Awad who were actively involved in shooting attacks and procuring weapons for terrorist activities.

message: Lebanese channels report that two were injured (one in serious condition) in the attack on a van in Chaqra in southern Lebanon by an Israeli UAV earlier today.
event_breakdown: Lebanese channels report that two were injured (one in serious condition) in the attack on a van in Chaqra in southern Lebanon by an Israeli UAV earlier today.

message:
IDF operation in Khan Yunis

The Palestinians report a concentration of tanks in the area of ​​the waste site in eastern Deir al-Balah (near the fence marked with a red pin) and the movement of tanks towards the Sakha junction on street number 2 in the Qarara area in the north of Khan Yunis.
event_breakdown: IDF operation in Khan Yunis, in the southern part of the Gaza Strip. The IDF (Israel Defense Forces) reported a strike on a terrorist squad that launched incendiary balloons from the northern Gaza Strip into Israel on August 18th, 2021. The strike, which took place from an Israeli helicopter gunship, targeted a squad of ten people responsible for the launch of balloons carrying incendiary and explosive devices into Israel. The operation, ordered by the Gaza Division commander, was aimed at interdicting the activities of terror organizations in the Gaza Strip.

message:
Celebrating with the girls:
The 3 terrorists that the IDF killed this morning in a drone attack in Tulkarm were "celebrating their performance" by shooting in the air in high spirits.
The joy was premature - a few minutes later the UAV missile found them.

message:
Tulkarm: An IDF bulldozer is transporting the three terrorists who were killed in a drone attack to Israeli territory..

The Palestinians whine on the various channels: "The IDF is abusing their bodies."

In the past, such sights caused a round of fighting to break out in Gaza...

The Israeli Defence Force (IDF) transported their bodies to Israeli territory, which led to protests by the Palestinians on various channels. In the past, similar incidents have sparked rounds of fighting in Gaza. The IDF has been accused of abusing the bodies of the terrorists killed in the attack.

Love is love...

message:
The commanders of the military arms of Hamas and Fatah in Tulkarm were eliminated in a UAV attack this morning

Palestinian channels report that the IDF killed in Tulkarm:

1. Azkiham Nafe, the commander of the military wing of Hamas in Tulkarm (circled in green).

2. Muhammad Awad, Abu Abdu, commander of Fatah's Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades in Tulkarm.

3. Muhammad Badie (with the weapon covering his face in the picture), a prominent operative in the Al-Aqsa Martyrs Brigades of Fatah in Tulkarm.

The three walked around together (and not for the first time) and during a long IDF operation in Tulkarm and the refugee camp that began tonight, they set off explosives against IDF machinery.

They were eliminated in the same attack - the presence of the two commanders of the military arms of Hamas and Fatah together in Tulkarm indicates the close cooperation between the military arms.
Two birds with one shot!
This collaboration is happening not only in Tulkarm...
event_breakdown: The commanders of the military arms of Hamas and Fatah in Tulkarm were eliminated in a UAV attack this morning, in a UAV attack this morning.

message:
Khan Yunis, southern Gaza:
Some of the Gazans who evacuated from eastern Khan Yunis could not find lodging arrangements so they had to sleep on the ground in the Nasser Hospital square (which is seen as a safe place) or in nearby streets.

message: Meanwhile in La Jolla, California.

According to the police, the assailant has put forward far-reaching demands. Police have cordoned off the area around the bus. Traffic and emergency services are just a few meters away. "The mental condition of the gunman is the main challenge," a police spokesman says. Initially, no shots were fired during the operation.

MIDDLE EAST

message:
Palestinian journalists: transportation distress in the north of the Gaza Strip due to the smuggling of donkeys and horses to the south of the Gaza Strip

Palestinian journalists report on the severe mobility issues in Gaza City and the northern Gaza Strip in the last two weeks, as Gazan merchants took advantage of the permit given by the IDF to evacuate south from Gaza City (through the Netzerim crossing), on donkeys, horses and tuk-tuks.

According to the report, the merchants were able to sell the donkeys from the north in the south of the Gaza Strip for ten thousand dinars per head and the horses for 20 thousand dinars per head. The tuk-tuks were sold for the price of a donkey - ten thousand dinars.
Because of this, the journalists claim, there are almost no means of transportation left in the north of the Gaza Strip.

Some noted that the donkey has become more valuable than the humans in the Strip.
event_breakdown: Security-related current events reported in the provided text include a surge of merchant activity in the Gaza Strip, which has led to severe mobility issues in northern Gaza City, specifically in the last two weeks. Merchants took advantage of the permit given by the IDF to evacuate south from Gaza City, moving through the Netzerim crossing on donkeys, horses, and tuk-tuks. As a result, the donkeys and horses were sold for a substantial price in the southern region of the Gaza Strip, while the tuk-tuks were sold for the price of a donkey.

* Ongoing conflict with Israel

message: The condition of the cranes in Hodeidah port in Yemen after the attack by Israeli warplanes.
event_breakdown: Israeli warplanes carried out airstrikes on the port of Hodeidah in Yemen on Tuesday, targeting the infrastructure and cranes at the port. The attack caused significant damage, and four civilians were killed. The port is a vital lifeline for the delivery of humanitarian aid to Yemen, which has been devastated by a civil war.

message:
The IDF spokesperson published documentation from the 98th Division's entry into eastern Khan Yunis yesterday.
They entered on foot and with open vehicles, which says something about the threat level in the area...
event_breakdown:
On February 21, 2022, the Israeli Air Force (IAF) carried out airstrikes in the Gaza Strip in response to a rocket attack on the town of Sderot. The Israeli military said the strikes targeted Hamas infrastructure.

The Israeli government has approved the construction of a new settlement in the West Bank, the first in 25 years.

The Israeli army has deployed additional troops to the West Bank and Gaza Strip in response to ongoing violence. The deployment includes infantry, artillery and tanks.

The IDF's 98th Division has entered eastern Khan Yunis in southern Gaza on February 21, 2022.

message:
Viewer warning

Tulkarm: According to Palestinian sources, the "paramedic" who celebrated together with the operatives of the military branches of Hamas and Fatah in Tulkarm, minutes before they were killed, is Iman Salem Sarur.
Her sons are members of the Tulkarm Battalion and she "accompanies the operatives" and takes care of them during the fighting - a "combat medic".

According to these sources, she was killed in the attack.
She can be identified by what is wearing.
Her eldest son Abdullah is considered a "martyr".
A family deeply rooted in terrorism.

She was reportedly killed in the attack that she was celebrating with them. Her son, Abdullah, is considered as "martyr".
No other relevant current events of security were reported in the document.

message:
IDF: Projectile launch toward Israel by the Hamas terrorist organization fell inside the Gaza Strip and hit a school

Yesterday (Monday), several projectiles were launched by the Hamas terrorist organization from the area of Maghazi in the central Gaza Strip toward Israel. The projectiles did not cross into Israeli territory and fell inside the Gaza Strip. One of the projectiles fell and hit a school in the area of Nuseirat. 
The Hamas terrorist organization's rocket fire continues to endanger both Israeli and Gazan civilians alike. 

##
חַרְבָּם תָּבוֹא בְלִבָּם...
Their sword will come to their heart...
